thread.title: Fire Alarm Wakes Up Panthers in Seattle
thread.title_full: Fire Alarm Wakes Up Panthers in Seattle

author: Timothy Rapp
title: Fire Alarm Wakes Up Panthers in Seattle
text:
Fire Alarm Wakes Up Panthers in Seattle Bleacher Report 2 hrs ago Timothy Rapp © Phelan M. Ebenhack/Associated Press The Carolina Panthers were forced to evacuate their Seattle hotel early Sunday morning after a fire alarm went off in the building, according to Ian Rapoport of NFL .com.
AdChoices The team tweeted and released a statement after the incident:
When the fire alarm goes off at 6AM.We can't wait to hit the field anyway. #CARvsSEA #KeepPounding pic.twitter.com/4B3eVn9Zgi
— Carolina Panthers (@Panthers) October 18, 2015
The #Panthers statement on someone pulling the fire alarm at their hotel in Seattle pic.twitter.com/Rn1trhfDg9
— Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) October 18, 2015
Backup quarterback Derek Anderson wasn't so sure the fire alarm sounding was a coincidence, tweeting, "Just happened to be our floors only. Guess that's just by chance lol."
Running back Jonathan Stewart added:
Fire alarm at 530am 👀
— Jonathan Stewart (@Jonathanstewar1) October 18, 2015
Kicker Graham Gano provided a photo of the experience:
Who pulled the fire alarm...😒 pic.twitter.com/n7Wmv5oShD
— Graham Gano (@GrahamGano) October 18, 2015
Meanwhile, veteran cornerback Charles Tillman had this to say:
Whoever pulled the fire alarm on the 16th floor....not cool. 👎🏿👎🏿
— Charles Tillman (@peanuttillman) October 18, 2015
The 2-3 Seattle Seahawks blew a fourth-quarter lead against the Cincinnati Bengals a week ago. On the other side, the Panthers are off to an excellent start this year, bringing a 4-0 record into Seattle.
